backends¶

class djangoerp.core.backends.ModelBackend[código fonte]¶

A proxy model-level backend.

NOTE: the purpose of this backend is a better integration with object-level permissions. By default, “django.contrib.auth.backends.ModelBackend” will return “False” when “has_perm” is invoked passing an object instance. This proxy backend, instead, will return “True” if the user has the correct model-level permission. The idea is that a model-level permission is a generic permission over all instances, so if the user has a permission on a model class, this means he has a permission over all its instances.

authenticate(username=None, password=None, **kwargs)[código fonte]¶

get_user_permissions(user_obj, obj=None)[código fonte]¶

Returns a set of permission strings the user user_obj has from their user_permissions.

has_module_perms(user_obj, app_label)[código fonte]¶

Returns True if user_obj has any permissions in the given app_label.

has_perm(user_obj, perm, obj=None)[código fonte]¶
class djangoerp.core.backends.ObjectPermissionBackend[código fonte]¶

Backend which enables support for row/object-level permissions.

NOTE: this backend only handles row/object-level permissions. It must works in conjunction which Django’s model backend, not as a replacement. In fact, if a user has only model-level permissions over a certain model (but no row/object-level ones for that particular model instance) this backend’s “has_perm” method will return a negative response.

authenticate(username, password)[código fonte]¶
get_all_permissions(user_obj, obj=None)[código fonte]¶

Returns all and only the object perms granted to the given user_obj.

get_group_permissions(user_obj, obj=None)[código fonte]¶

Returns all and only the object perms granted to the groups of the given user_obj.

get_user_permissions(user_obj, obj=None)[código fonte]¶

Returns all and only the object perms granted to the user_obj itself.

has_perm(user_obj, perm, obj=None)[código fonte]¶

This method checks if the user_obj has perm on obj.

supports_anonymous_user = True¶
supports_inactive_user = True¶
supports_object_permissions = True¶
